revisions.rev:
{{Main article|Commemorative coins of Poland}} In the year 2009 coins were issued in the series: "History of the Polish Cavalry", "Animals of the World", "Polandâs path to liberation", "History of Polish Popular Music", "Polish Painters" and various occasional coins.{{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/Banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/plan_2009.xls | title=Schedule for Issuance of Polish Collector Coins for the 2009 Year (Polish version) | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-11}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009.html | title=Coins issued in 2010 (English version) | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-11}} {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''History of the [[Polish Cavalry]]:'''''
The [[Polish Hussars]] (Winged cavalryman) - 17th Century (gold){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009/HUSARZ_en.pdf | title= The Polish Hussars golden coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-05}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Andrzej Nowakowski | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 10,500 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 23 January 2009{{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zl Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 2009 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-05}} | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 1.645 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: At the top, on the right-hand side, an image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Below the Eagle, an inscription, 200 ZÅ. Above the Eagle, the notation of the year of issue, 2009. In the middle of the coin, the stylized images of parts of the hussarâs gear: [[Capeline|zischÃ¤gge helmet]], breastplate, a mace and a lance with a pennant. On the left-hand side and at the bottom, a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. The Mintâs mark, m/w, under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: A stylized image of the hussar of the 17th century, on horseback, in armour, with wings and leopard skin on the back, holding a lance with a pennant. On the left-hand side and at the bottom, a semicircular inscription: HUSARZ â XVII w. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''History of the [[Polish Cavalry]]:'''''
The [[Polish Hussars]] (Winged cavalryman) - 17th Century (silver) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Andrzej Nowakowski | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 100,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 23 January 2009 | align=center | '''Dimensions:'''

Underneath, on the left-hand side, stylized images of parts of the Hussarâs gear: a pennant, [[Capeline|zischÃ¤gge helmet]] and a mace. At the bottom, an inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA/POLSKA. The Mintâs mark, M/W, under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: A stylized image of the hussar of the 17th century, on horseback, in armour, with hussarâs wings and leopard skin on the back, holding a lance with a pennant. On the right-hand side, a vertical inscription, HUSARZ â XVII w. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"|90th anniversary of Establishment of the [[Supreme Chamber of Control of the Republic of Poland]] (silver) {{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009/NIK_en.pdf | title=90th anniversary of Establishment of the Supreme Chamber of Control of the Republic of Poland coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-02-08}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Urszula Walerzak | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) with hologram | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 100,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 6 February 2009 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 73 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: At the top, an image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. On the left side of the Eagle, an inscription, 10. On the right side of the Eagle, an inscription, ZÅ. Below the Eagle, an oval hologram with a stylized image of the NIK logo, that changes colour depending on the viewing angle. Surrounding the hologram are some decorative elements. In the rim, a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and the notation of the year of issue, 2009. The Mintâs mark, m/w, under the Eagleâs left leg. ROCZNICA/UTWORZENIA. (90th anniversary of Establishment). At the bottom, a semicircular inscription, NAJWYÅ»SZEJ/IZBY KONTROLI ([[Supreme Chamber of Control of the Republic of Poland]]). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"|180 years of [[National Bank of Poland|Central Banking in Poland]] (gold){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009/180_en.pdf | title=180 Years of Central Banking in Poland coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-04-16}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 8,500 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 30 March 2009 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 2.110 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: In the centre, an image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. At the bottom, on the right side, the notation of the year of issue, 2009. Below, an inscription: 10 ZÅ. At the top, a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. The lizard on the left - standing on the rocks. In the background above and below, stylized images of plants. At the top, a semicircular inscription: JASZCZURKA ZIELONA - Lacerta Viridis. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''Polandâs path to liberation:'''''
[[Polish legislative election, 1989|The election of 4 June 1989]] (gold){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009/4c.pdf | title=Polandâs Road to Freedom; The election of 4 June 1989 coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-06-13}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Urszula Walerzak | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 10,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 3 June 2009 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: At the top and in the centre, an image of the Eagle, established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Below, on the left-hand side, a stylized image of port cranes, and on the right-hand side, a stylized image of a mineshaft. At the top, a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and the notation of the year of issue, 2009. At the bottom, an inscription, 200 ZÅ. The Mintâs mark, m/w, under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: On the right-hand side, the silhouette of a person raising a hand and making the âV for victoryâ sign. In the background, a stylized image of the Sejm hall and people inside. At the top, an inscription, 12.09.1989. On the left-hand side and at the bottom, a semicircular inscription, PIERWSZY RZÄD WIELKIEJ PRZEMIANY. In the word "WIELKIEJ", a stylized image of the national flag. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''Polandâs path to liberation:'''''

Above the eagle, an inscription, 10 ZÅ. At the top, a semicircular inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA, and the notation of the year of issue,2009. The Mintâs mark, m/w, under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: On the left-hand side, a stylized image of Pope John Paul II holding a crosier, with crowds of people in the background. Above the crowd, an inscription, SOLIDARNOÅÄ, replicating the logo of the Independent and Self-governing Solidarity Trade Union in red and grey colours. Above, an inscription, 1979/1989. At the top, a semicircular inscription, "NIECH ZSTÄPI DUCH TWÃJ! I ODNOWI OBLICZE ZIEMI". At the bottom, an inscription, "TEJ ZIEMI!". |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''History of Polish Popular Music:'' [[CzesÅaw Niemen]]{{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009/czeslaw_niemen_en.pdf | title= History of Polish Light Music: CzesÅaw Niemen coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2010-04-30}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 100,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 19 June 2009 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: At the bottom and on the left-hand side, an image of the Eagle, established as the state Emblem of the republic of Poland. On the right side of the Eagle, an inscription, 10 ZÅ. At the top and on the right-hand side, the notation of the year of issue, 2009. In the centre, the images of two portraits of CzesÅaw Niemen: on the right-hand side, a semi-profile portrait; on the left-hand side, a stylized fragment of front portrait. Below the image of the portrait and on its right-hand side, an inscription, RZECZPOSPOLITA; on the right-hand side, it runs in a perpendicular manner. On the right-hand side, a perpendicular inscription, POLSKA. On the left-hand side, a perpendicular inscription, NIEMEN. The Mintâs mark, M/W, under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: A stylized image of the cover of the album entitled "sen o Warszawie", featuring an image of the figure of CzesÅaw Niemen. At the bottom, a visible inscription, niemen/sen o warszawie, on the album cover. On the left-hand side, a perpendicular inscription, HISTORIA, against the album cover. At the bottom, an inscription, POLSKIEJ MUZYKI. On the right-hand side, a perpendicular inscription, ROZRYWKOWEJ. Next to it, the words CZESLAW NIEMEN, inscribed perpendicularly in an opposite direction. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''History of Polish Popular Music:'' [[CzesÅaw Niemen]] (square) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 100,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 19 June 2009 | align=center | '''Dimensions:'''

At the top and on the right-hand side, the notation of the year of issue, 2009. In the centre, an image of the portrait of CzesÅaw Niemen. On the left-hand side, a perpendicular inscription, NIEMEN/CZESÅAW. Next to it, the word RZECZPOSPOLITA, inscribed perpendicularly in an opposite direction. At the bottom and on the left-hand side, an inscription, POLSKA 10 ZÅ. The Mintâs mark, M/W, under the Eagleâs left leg. At the top a visible inscription on the album cover, N.AE./ KATHARSIS. On the left-hand side, a perpendicular inscription, HISTORIA POLSKIEJ, against the album cover. At the bottom, an inscription, MUZYKI ROZRYWKOWEJ, against the album cover. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 65th Anniversary of the Warsaw Uprising
Warsaw-born poets (K. K. BaczyÅski){{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009/65_rocznica_powstania_warszawskiego_en.pdf | title=65th anniversary of the Warsaw Uprising: Warsaw poets Krzysztof Kamil Baczynski and Tadeusz Gajcy coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2010-04-30}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Roussanka Nowakowska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Inner core: Ag 925/1000,
Outer ring Ag 925/1000 plated with Au 999/1000 | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 100,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 July 2009 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: At the top, an image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland against the background of a stylised rift in a wall flled by fames. To the right of the Eagle, the notation of the year of issue: 2009. Below, an inscription: 10 ZÅ. In the centre, an inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA/POLSKA (Republic of Poland). On the left and right, stylised silhouettes of burning buildings. In the rim, a circumscription: 65. ROCZNICA POWSTANIA WARSZAWSKIEGO (65th anniversary of the Warsaw Uprising). At the bottom, in a semicircular fashion, stylised images of sheets of paper, a book, a helmet and the Symbol of Fighting Poland, against the background of a stylised image of a brick wall fragment. The Mintâs mark: M/W under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: In the centre, against the background of a stylised image of fames, a stylised bust of Krzysztof Kamil BaczyÅski with a badge of âAgricolaâ pinned to his jacket. At the top, a semicircular inscription: KRZYSZTOF KAMIL BACZYÅSKI. On the right-hand side, an inscription: POECI/WARSZAWSCY (Warsaw Poets). At the bottom, on the right, against the background of a stylised image of sheets of paper, an excerpt from the poem "PocaÅunek" (A Kiss) by Krzysztof Kamil BaczyÅski: "â¦TRZEBA/NAM TERAZ/UMIERAÄ/BY POLSKA/UMIAÅA/ZNÃW/Å»YÄ." (we have to die now, so that Poland could live). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 65th Anniversary of the Warsaw Uprising
Warsaw-born poets (T. Gajcy) |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Roussanka Nowakowska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Inner core: Ag 925/1000 plated with Au 999/1000,
Outer ring Ag 925/1000 | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 100,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 July 2009 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: At the top, an image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. To the right of the Eagle, an inscription: 10 ZÅ. Under the inscription, the notation of the year of issue: 2009. To the left of the Eagle, a stylised image of burning buildings and an explosion in front of them. Under the Eagle, a stylised image of the national flag of the Republic of Poland above a collapsed brick wall. Against the background of the wall, an excerpt of the poem âDo potomnegoâ by Tadeusz Gajcy: "â¦IDÄ PRZEZ POWIETRZE, A ZA MNÄ MIASTO MOJE IDZIEâ (I walk through the air, and my city walks with me). At the top, a semicircular inscription: 65. ROCZNICA POWSTANIA WARSZAWSKIEGO (65th anniversary of the Warsaw Uprising). At the bottom, a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA (Republic of Poland). The Mintâs mark, M/W, under the Eagleâs left leg. Reverse: In the centre, a stylised image of a bust of Tadeusz Gajcy in profle. On the right, an outline of a fragment of a rife. At the top, a semicircular inscription: TADEUSZ GAJCY. At the bottom, in the background of a stylised image of a sheet of paper, an inscription: POECI/WARSZAWSCY (Warsaw Poets). On the left, a fragment of a stylised image of the Symbol of Fighting Poland. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 95th Anniversary of [[First Cadre Company]] March Out {{cite web | url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2009/95_rocznica_wymarszu_pierwszej_kompanii_kadrowej_en.pdf | title=95th Anniversary of First Cadre Company March Out coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2010-05-01}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Robert Kotowicz | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 50,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 5 August 2009 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: On the right-hand side, an image of the Eagle established as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland.
